net.viktorc.pspp

Interface CommandListener


  • public interface CommandListener
    A listener that allows for the processing of the outputs of a process. It is temporarily subscribed to a ProcessManager instance when the executeCommand method is called. It listens to the standard out and error out streams of the process and the respective method is invoked every time a new line is printed to one of these streams. Besides possible processing activities, these methods are also responsible for determining when the process finished processing the command. E.g. if a process takes the command "go" which triggers the execution of long-running task, and it prints "ready" to the standard out stream once the task is completed; the methods should only return true if the output "ready" has been written to standard out, in any other case, they should return false. The interface also defines a method that is called once the command has been written to the process' standard in and a method called once the command has been processed and all the related post-processing activities has been completed.
    Author:
    A6714

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void onFinished()
      A method called once the post-processing activities associated with the command has been completed.
      boolean onNewErrorOutput(String errorOutput)
      A method called every time a new line is printed to the error out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
      boolean onNewStandardOutput(String standardOutput)
      A method called every time a new line is printed to the standard out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
      default void onSubmitted()
      A method called once the command has been written to the process' standard in.

    • Method Detail

      • onNewStandardOutput

        boolean onNewStandardOutput(String standardOutput)
        A method called every time a new line is printed to the standard out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
        Parameters:
        standardOutput - The new line of output printed to the standard out of the process.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the previously sent command. The ProcessManager instance will not accept new commands until the processing of the command is completed.

      • onNewErrorOutput

        boolean onNewErrorOutput(String errorOutput)
        A method called every time a new line is printed to the error out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
        Parameters:
        errorOutput - The new line of output printed to the error out of the process.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the previously sent command. The ProcessManager instance will not accept new commands until the processing of the command is completed.

      • onSubmitted

        default void onSubmitted()
        A method called once the command has been written to the process' standard in.

      • onFinished

        default void onFinished()
        A method called once the post-processing activities associated with the command has been completed.
